attributes.action: Make the Prime Minister issue a formal apology.
attributes.additional_details:
MP Tanmanjeet Singh Dhesi brought this issue to the forefront of the House of Commons beautifully.
Some of the things that the Prime Minister has said are:
- saying that Muslim women who wear the burqa or niqab as “looking like letterboxes.” 
-  “an awful lot of police time now goes into these historic offences and all this mullarkey.” [talking about child sex abuse cases.]
-spoke about Black children as “flag-wearing picaninnies.”
-“Face it: it’s all your own fat fault.”
attributes.background: The Prime Minister of the United Kingdom has been quoted as saying derogatory and hateful comments. This is truly unacceptable behaviour and he still has not apologised. In a modern UK, accountability for one’s actions must take place, that kind of speech has no place here.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the Prime Minister, rather than the Government or Parliament as a whole.
